channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Iran’s Supreme Leader Says Protests Are Happening to ‘Please’ Trump
item.description: After days of fierce protest in cities around Iran, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei dismissed the demonstrations as vandalism and wanton destruction.

item.title: The War Over the Weedkiller Roundup Might Be Headed to the Supreme Court
item.description: Bayer has asked the justices to decide whether federal law shields the company from lawsuits over its Roundup herbicide and cancer. Democrats and MAHA...

item.title: Verizon chief talent officer says Gen Z grads shouldn’t snub retail or hospitality jobs in the current economy: ‘Just start somewhere’
item.description: As AI steals entry-level office jobs, Verizon’s chief talent officer says Gen Z grads should be 'open to a different path.' Namely, retail and hospita...

item.title: Singapore-based startup founder Anand Roy thinks generative AI can help fix a broken music sector
item.description: Roy started Wubble in 2024; now his generated tunes are used by global giants and even the Taipei Metro, to soothe harried commuters.

item.title: Why Many Republican Voters Support Trump’s Use of Force in Venezuela
item.description: They don’t like nation building, but they do want to project American power.

item.title: Wary of Investing in Venezuela, Big Oil Heads to the White House
item.description: The amounts of money, time and political uncertainty trouble executives at large Western oil companies, who plan to meet with President Trump on Frida...

item.title: What to Know About the Latest Jobs Report
item.description: Data on the labor market in December will be closely watched for clues on the state of the economy.

item.title: How an Abrupt Call Between Trump and Colombia’s President Averted a Crisis
item.description: President Gustavo Petro said that the new tone between the leaders was “friendly,” but he also resurfaced his deep disagreements with President Trump.

item.title: Runway Wall Caused All the Deaths in 2024 South Korean Plane Crash, Report Says
item.description: A computer simulation ordered by the government showed that everyone on board would have survived if the concrete berm had been made of materials that...

item.title: Venezuela Updates: Senate Advances Measure to Curb Trump’s Use of Force
item.description: In a rebuke to the president, the Senate narrowly agreed to bring up a War Powers Act resolution for a vote next week. The measure would require Mr. T...

item.title: Iran’s Supreme Leader Says Protests Are Happening to ‘Please’ Trump
item.description: After days of fierce protest in cities around Iran, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei dismissed the demonstrations as vandalism and wanton destruction.

item.title: Tennessee theater professor reinstated, with $500,000 settlement, after losing his job over a Charlie Kirk-related social media post
item.description: Sen. Marsha Blackburn had circulated a screenshot indicating the professor had posted a headline about Charlie Kirk's stance on the 2nd Amendment.

item.title: Mass shootings on campus give rise to a new kind of life-saving service journalism: an anonymous message board called Sidechat
item.description: Described by Harvard Magazine as “the College’s stream of collective consciousness,” Sidechat allows anyone with a verified university email to post.

item.title: From George Floyd to Trump calling Somali immigrants ‘garbage’ to a fatal ICE shooting, Minnesota’s in the crosshairs
item.description: In June, a Democratic state lawmaker and her husband were assassinated by a Trump supporter, although conservatives blame Tim Walz.
